ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Study stage
Notes: 0 = Pre-Randomization (TADS) 1 = Stage 1 (TADS) 2 = Stage 2 (TADS) 3 = Stage 3 (TADS) 4 = Stage 4 (TADS) 5 = Stage 5 (SOFTAD); 51=Treatmentas Usual; 52=Screening Alone; 53=Intervention; 67=Unknown; -888=Not Applicable; -999=Missing;

ElementDescription: Premature Termination Category
Notes: no = no PMT; s1 = Stage 1 PMT; s1s = Stage 1 Switcher; s2 = Stage 2 PMT; s3 = Stage 3 PMT

ElementDescription: Study Drop Category
Notes: no = no Drop; s1 = Stage 1 Drop; s2 = Stage 2 Drop; s3 = Stage 3 Drop

ElementDescription: Indicator of whether patient received a non-ASAP PT session during the stage (only counting sessions where it was clear the patient had been on drug on the session date).Note: This assumes that all PBO patients received FLX after Stage I PMT if PT sessions continued.
Indicator of whether patient received a non-ASAP CBT session during the stage.
First non-TADS treatment type (based on alphabetical text listing of treatment received) prescribed in the stage.
Notes: 1 = Anti-depressant; 2 = Stimulant; 3 = Anti-anxiety; 4 = Neuroleptic; 5 = Mood stabilizer; 6 = Other medication; 7 = CBT; 8 = Other psychosocial

ElementDescription: Second non-TADS treatment type (based on alphabetical text listing of treatment received) prescribed in the stage.
